name: crudkit
title: CRUDKit
description: A comprehensive CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) system built with React compound components pattern. Provides complete data management functionality including: URL-synchronized state management, server-side pagination with configurable page sizes, multi-field filtering with dynamic filter UI, column sorting (ascending/descending), bulk operations (select multiple, delete), inline search across all fields, create/edit/view modes with form validation, error handling with user feedback, loading states, and flexible data provider interface supporting REST APIs, GraphQL, tRPC, or any backend. Implements best practices with TypeScript type safety, accessible UI patterns, and responsive design. Perfect for building admin panels, dashboards, content management systems, and any data-driven application requiring full CRUD capabilities.

files.content:
/**
 * Table Components
 *
 * Export all table components for easy import and extension.
 *
 * @example
 * ```typescript
 * import { Cell, Row } from '@/components/crudkit/table'
 *
 * // Extend components
 * const MyCell: React.FC<CellProps> = (props) => {
 *   if (props.field.name === 'status') {
 *     return <TableCell><Badge>{props.value}</Badge></TableCell>
 *   }
 *   return <Cell {...props} />
 * }
 * ```
 */

export { DefaultRow as Row } from './row'
export { DefaultCell as Cell } from './cell'
export { DefaultActions as Actions } from './actions'
export { DefaultHeader as Header } from './header'
export { DefaultEmptyState as EmptyState } from './empty-state'
export { DefaultLoadingState as LoadingState } from './loading-state'

import * as React from 'react' import { TableCell } from '@/components/ui/table' import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button' import { cn } from '@/lib/utils' import type { ActionsProps } from '@/lib/crudkit/types' /** * Default Actions Component * * Renders action buttons for view, edit, and delete operations. * Override this component to customize the action buttons * (e.g., use a dropdown menu, add more actions, etc.). * * @example * ```typescript * import { DropdownMenu } from '@/components/ui/dropdown-menu' * * const MyActions: React.FC = ({ row, onView, onEdit, onDelete }) => ( * * * Actions * * View * Edit * Delete * * * * ) * ``` */ export const DefaultActions = React.forwardRef( ({ row, onView, onEdit, onDelete, className, schema, actions, state }, ref) => { return (
) } ) DefaultActions.displayName = 'DefaultActions'

import * as React from 'react' import { TableRow, TableCell } from '@/components/ui/table' import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button' import { cn } from '@/lib/utils' import type { EmptyStateProps } from '@/lib/crudkit/types' /** * Default EmptyState Component * * Shown when no data is available in the table. * Displays different messages based on whether filters are active. * * @example * ```typescript * const MyEmptyState: React.FC = ({ hasFilters, onClearFilters }) => ( * * *
* *

No items found

* {hasFilters && ( * * )} *
* * * ) * ``` */ export const DefaultEmptyState = React.forwardRef( ({ message, hasFilters, onClearFilters, className, schema, actions, state }, ref) => { return (

{message || 'No data found'}

{hasFilters && ( )}
) } ) DefaultEmptyState.displayName = 'DefaultEmptyState'

import * as React from 'react' import { TableRow, TableCell } from '@/components/ui/table' import { Skeleton } from '@/components/ui/skeleton' import { cn } from '@/lib/utils' import type { LoadingStateProps } from '@/lib/crudkit/types' /** * Default LoadingState Component * * Shown while data is being fetched. * Displays skeleton loaders for a better UX. * * @example * ```typescript * const MyLoadingState: React.FC = ({ rowCount = 5 }) => ( * <> * {Array.from({ length: rowCount }).map((_, i) => ( * * * * * * ))} * * ) * ``` */ export const DefaultLoadingState = React.forwardRef( ({ rowCount, className, schema, actions, state }, ref) => { const skeletonRows = rowCount ?? state.pageSize ?? 5 return (
) } ) DefaultLoadingState.displayName = 'DefaultLoadingState'

/**
 * Form Components
 *
 * Export all form components for easy import and extension.
 *
 * @example
 * ```typescript
 * import { Field, FormLayout } from '@/components/crudkit/form'
 *
 * // Extend components
 * const MyField: React.FC<FieldProps> = (props) => {
 *   if (props.field.name === 'avatar') {
 *     return <ImageUploadField {...props} />
 *   }
 *   return <Field {...props} />
 * }
 *
 * <Crud.Form components={{ Field: MyField }} />
 * ```
 */

export { DefaultField as Field } from './field'
export { DefaultFormLayout as FormLayout } from './form-layout'
export { DefaultSubmitButton as SubmitButton } from './submit-button'

import * as React from 'react' import { Alert, AlertDescription } from '@/components/ui/alert' import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button' import { cn } from '@/lib/utils' import type { FormLayoutProps } from '@/lib/crudkit/types' /** * Default FormLayout Component * * Wraps the entire form with title, error display, and action buttons. * Override this to change the form structure (e.g., multi-column, wizard, card layout). * * @example * ```typescript * import { Card, CardHeader, CardContent, CardFooter } from '@/components/ui/card' * * const CardFormLayout: React.FC = ({ children, title, error, onSubmit, onCancel }) => ( * * *

{title}

* * *
* {error && {error}} *
{children}
*
* * * * * * * ) * * * ``` */ export const DefaultFormLayout = React.forwardRef( ({ children, title, error, onSubmit, onCancel, isSubmitting, mode, className, schema, actions, state }, ref) => { const handleSubmit = (e: React.FormEvent) => { e.preventDefault() onSubmit() } return (

{title}

{error && ( {error} )} {children}
) } ) DefaultFormLayout.displayName = 'DefaultFormLayout'

import * as React from 'react'
import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button'
import { cn } from '@/lib/utils'
import type { SubmitButtonProps } from '@/lib/crudkit/types'

/**
 * Default SubmitButton Component
 *
 * Submit button with loading state and dynamic text based on mode.
 * Override this to customize the submit button appearance or add additional functionality.
 *
 * @example
 * ```typescript
 * const CustomSubmitButton: React.FC<SubmitButtonProps> = ({ isSubmitting, mode, disabled }) => (
 *   <Button
 *     type="submit"
 *     disabled={isSubmitting || disabled}
 *     className="bg-green-500"
 *   >
 *     {isSubmitting ? (
 *       <>
 *         <Spinner className="mr-2" />
 *         Saving...
 *       </>
 *     ) : (
 *       <>
 *         <CheckIcon className="mr-2" />
 *         {mode === 'create' ? 'Create' : 'Update'}
 *       </>
 *     )}
 *   </Button>
 * )
 *
 * <Crud.Form components={{ SubmitButton: CustomSubmitButton }} />
 * ```
 */
export const DefaultSubmitButton = React.forwardRef<HTMLButtonElement, SubmitButtonProps>(
  ({ isSubmitting, disabled, mode, className, schema, actions, state }, ref) => {
    return (
      <Button
        ref={ref}
        type="submit"
        disabled={isSubmitting || disabled}
        className={cn(className)}
      >
        {isSubmitting ? 'Saving...' : 'Save'}
      </Button>
    )
  }
)
DefaultSubmitButton.displayName = 'DefaultSubmitButton'

/** * Filter Components * * Export all filter components for easy import and extension. * * @example * ```typescript * import { Filter, FilterInput, FilterLayout } from '@/components/crudkit/filters' * * // Extend filter * const DateRangeFilter: React.FC = (props) => { * const { field, value, onChange } = props * * if (field.type === 'date') { * return ( *
* * *
* ) * } * * return * } * * * ``` */ export { DefaultFilter as Filter } from './filter' export { DefaultFilterInput as FilterInput } from './filter-input' export { DefaultFilterLayout as FilterLayout } from './filter-layout'

import * as React from 'react' import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button' import { cn } from '@/lib/utils' import type { FilterLayoutProps } from '@/lib/crudkit/types' /** * Default FilterLayout Component * * Wraps the entire filters section with title and clear button. * Override this to customize the overall filter container layout. * * @example * ```typescript * import type { FilterLayoutProps } from '@/registry/default/crudkit/crudkit/components/filters' * import { Card, CardHeader, CardContent, CardFooter } from '@/components/ui/card' * * const CardFilterLayout: React.FC = ({ children, onClearFilters, hasActiveFilters }) => ( * * *

Filter Results

* * *
{children}
* * {hasActiveFilters && ( * * * * )} * * ) * * * ``` */ export const DefaultFilterLayout = React.forwardRef( ({ children, onClearFilters, hasActiveFilters, className, schema, actions, state }, ref) => { return (

Filters

{children}
) } ) DefaultFilterLayout.displayName = 'DefaultFilterLayout'

/**
 * Toolbar Compound Components
 *
 * Export all toolbar components for use in Crud.
 *
 * @example
 * ```typescript
 * import { Toolbar } from '@/components/crudkit/toolbar'
 *
 * // Use compound component
 * <Toolbar>
 *   <Toolbar.Title>My Title</Toolbar.Title>
 *   <Toolbar.CreateButton />
 * </Toolbar>
 * ```
 */

export { Toolbar } from './toolbar'
export { ToolbarTitle } from './title'
export { ToolbarCreateButton } from './create-button'
export { ToolbarRefreshButton } from './refresh-button'

import * as React from 'react' import { cn } from '@/lib/utils' import { useCrudContext } from '../crud' import type { ToolbarProps } from '@/lib/crudkit/types' import { ToolbarTitle } from './title' import { ToolbarCreateButton } from './create-button' import { ToolbarRefreshButton } from './refresh-button' /** * Toolbar Root Component * * Container for toolbar items. Provides default layout or accepts custom children. * * @example * ```typescript * // Default layout (Title + CreateButton + RefreshButton) * * * // Custom children * * My Users *
* * * *
* * * // Fully custom layout * *
*
* * * 24 members *
*
* * *
*
* * ``` */ const ToolbarRoot = React.forwardRef( ({ className, children, schema, actions, state }, ref) => { const context = useCrudContext() // Only show toolbar in list mode if (context.state.mode !== 'list') return null return (
{children || ( <>
)}
) } ) ToolbarRoot.displayName = 'Crud.Toolbar' /** * Toolbar Compound Component * * Export root component with sub-components attached. * This enables the dot notation API: Crud.Toolbar.Title, Crud.Toolbar.CreateButton, etc. */ export const Toolbar = Object.assign(ToolbarRoot, { Title: ToolbarTitle, CreateButton: ToolbarCreateButton, RefreshButton: ToolbarRefreshButton, })

import * as React from 'react' import { Slot } from '@radix-ui/react-slot' import { cn } from '@/lib/utils' import { useCrudContext } from '../crud' import type { ToolbarTitleProps } from '@/lib/crudkit/types' /** * Toolbar.Title Component * * Displays the resource title. Supports asChild pattern for custom rendering. * * @example * ```typescript * // Default usage * * * // Custom text * My Custom Title * * // With custom styling * * Team Members * * * // With asChild (render as custom element) * *

* Team Members *

* * ``` */ export const ToolbarTitle = React.forwardRef( ({ asChild = false, className, children }, ref) => { const { schema } = useCrudContext() const Comp = asChild ? Slot : 'h2' return ( {children || `${schema.title} Management`} ) } ) ToolbarTitle.displayName = 'Crud.Toolbar.Title'

/** * View Components * * Export all view components for easy import and extension. * * @example * ```typescript * import { ViewField, ViewLayout } from '@/components/crudkit/view' * * // Extend components * const MyViewField: React.FC = (props) => { * if (props.field.name === 'createdAt') { * return ( *
* {props.field.label}: * {new Date(props.value).toLocaleDateString()} *
* ) * } * return * } * * * ``` */ export { DefaultViewField as ViewField } from './view-field' export { DefaultViewLayout as ViewLayout } from './view-layout'

import * as React from 'react' import { cn } from '@/lib/utils' import type { ViewFieldProps } from '@/lib/crudkit/types' /** * Default ViewField Component * * Displays a single field in detail view with label and value. * Override this for global field display customization or use fieldRenderers for specific fields. * * @example * ```typescript * import { DefaultViewField } from '@/registry/default/crudkit/crudkit/components/view' * import { Avatar, AvatarImage } from '@/components/ui/avatar' * * // Extend default view field * const MyViewField: React.FC = (props) => { * if (props.field.name === 'avatar') { * return ( *
* {props.field.label}: * *
* ) * } * return * } * * // Use with Crud.View * * ``` */ export const DefaultViewField = React.forwardRef( ({ field, value, item, className, schema, actions, state }, ref) => { return (
{field.label}:{' '} {value ?? '-'}
) } ) DefaultViewField.displayName = 'DefaultViewField'

import * as React from 'react' import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button' import { Skeleton } from '@/components/ui/skeleton' import { cn } from '@/lib/utils' import type { ViewLayoutProps } from '@/lib/crudkit/types' /** * Default ViewLayout Component * * Wraps the entire detail view with title, fields, and action buttons. * Override this to change the view structure (e.g., card layout, tabs, sections). * * @example * ```typescript * import { Card, CardHeader, CardContent, CardFooter } from '@/components/ui/card' * * const CardViewLayout: React.FC = ({ children, item, onEdit, onBack, schema }) => ( * * *

View {schema.title}

* * *
{children}
* * * * * * * ) * * * ``` */ export const DefaultViewLayout = React.forwardRef( ({ children, item, onEdit, onBack, className, schema, actions, state }, ref) => { return (

View {schema.title}

{state.loading && (
{schema.fields.map((field) => (
))}
)} {!state.loading && item && (
{children}
)}
) } ) DefaultViewLayout.displayName = 'DefaultViewLayout'
